title: Gaming, animation, VFX market projected to touch $6.8 billion by 2026: report
description: The Animation, Visual Effects, Gaming, Comics, and Extended Reality (AVGC-XR) sector, currently accounting for 20% of India's M&E industry, is gaining momentum and is expected to continue expanding. The report underscores the sector’s potential as a major employment driver. The sector is expected to create over 160,000 new jobs annually, with a total of 20 lakh new jobs anticipated by 2030.
content: The online gaming, animation, and VFX market in India is estimated to be worth $6.8 billion by 2026, up from $3.92 billion in 2023, according to a CII-Grant Thornton report titled FX & Beyond: Shaping India’s AVGC Landscape.On a standalone basis, the online gaming industry, valued at $2.62 billion in 2023, is projected to reach $4.6 billion by 2026, with its contribution to the media & entertainment (M&E) sector increasing from 10% to 13%.Likewise, the Animation & VFX segment is predicted to grow from $1.3 billion in 2023 to $2.2 billion by 2026, increasing its share of the M&E industry from 5% to 6% during this period.The report, which was released by Information & Broadcasting (I&B) secretary Sanjay Jaju, states that the Indian M&E industry is projected to grow by 10.2%, reaching $30.8 billion by 2024 and reaching $37.2 billion by 2026 at a CAGR of 10%.The Animation, Visual Effects, Gaming, Comics, and Extended Reality (AVGC-XR) sector, currently accounting for 20% of India's M&E industry, is gaining momentum and is expected to continue expanding.
